Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 12

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 12

Continue building your intermediate vocabulary with these essential words for effective communication.

Navigation

This is page 12 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Language

/ˈlæŋɡwɪdʒ/

noun

The method of human communication, either spoken or written.

"Learning a new language opens doors to different cultures."

Synonyms: speech, communication, tongue

Category: Communication

Legal

/ˈliːɡəl/

adjective

Relating to the law; permitted by law.

"It's important to understand the legal requirements before starting a business."

Synonyms: lawful, legitimate, judicial

Category: Law

Level

/ˈlevəl/

noun, adjective

A position on a scale of intensity or quantity; having a flat, horizontal surface.

"She has reached an advanced level in her English studies."

Synonyms: degree, standard, grade

Category: Measurement

Location

/loʊˈkeɪʃən/

noun

A particular place or position.

"The restaurant has an excellent location in the city center."

Synonyms: place, position, site

Category: Place

Management

/ˈmænɪdʒmənt/

noun

The process of dealing with or controlling things or people.

"Good time management is essential for success in college."

Synonyms: administration, control, direction

Category: Control

Material

/məˈtɪriəl/

noun, adjective

The matter from which a thing is or can be made; physical rather than spiritual.

"The building is constructed from high-quality materials."

Synonyms: substance, matter, fabric

Category: Substance

Medical

/ˈmedɪkəl/

adjective

Relating to the science or practice of medicine.

"She decided to pursue a career in the medical field."

Synonyms: health-related, clinical, therapeutic

Category: Health

Method

/ˈmeθəd/

noun

A particular form of procedure for accomplishing or approaching something.

"This teaching method has proven very effective with young learners."

Synonyms: approach, technique, system

Category: Approach

Model

/ˈmɑːdəl/

noun, verb

A representation of something; to display something as an example.

"The new employee will model professional behavior for the team."

Synonyms: example, template, pattern

Category: Example

Natural

/ˈnætʃərəl/

adjective

Existing in or caused by nature; not made or caused by humankind.

"The park preserves the area's natural beauty and wildlife."

Synonyms: organic, native, innate

Category: Nature

Network

/ˈnetwɜːrk/

noun, verb

A group or system of interconnected people or things.

"Professional networking can help advance your career."

Synonyms: system, connection, web

Category: Connection

Normal

/ˈnɔːrməl/

adjective

Conforming to a standard; usual, typical, or expected.

"It's normal to feel nervous before an important presentation."

Synonyms: typical, standard, ordinary

Category: Standard
